Package peregrine.rpc

Basic RPC client framework which uses JSON over HTTP to encode and decode messages sent over the wire - this is not meant to be used for high throughput messages but instead meant for control messages between workers and the controller.

Class Summary
Message Deprecated. Moving to new JSON RPC system which makes this obsolete.
RpcClient Basic RPC client for sending messages to peregrine workers.
 

Package peregrine.rpc Description

Basic RPC client framework which uses JSON over HTTP to encode and decode messages sent over the wire - this is not meant to be used for high throughput messages but instead meant for control messages between workers and the controller.

Requirements are:

  • messages are small... less than 4k
  • messages are low throughput. Less than say 100 per minute.
  • messages can be easily decoded and used via REST from 3rd party APIs and clients. These are typically web interfaces, alerting and monitoring systems, python, etc.
  • messages are not binary
  • messages support lists of primitive types, strings, ints, floats, etc.
  • are implemented via simple POJOs following java bean semantics.
  • support running with uplevel clients and ignore new fields. This allows us to perform rolling upgrades in the cluster as new features are added
  • easy RPC implementation using reflection. Reflection is generally considered slow however for our use case this is fine because since our messages are very small and very infrequent it's better to have easy usage than maximum performance.
